page.title: 10PRIZE COWS
page.content: We looked at the Silage Bays,only one was full, as the weather has been so dry this year the grass has not grown. Outside were eight heifers that had been transplanted with eggs from a prize cow.The young calves had green tags in their ears.Green is the colour for 1985.We were given a handful of cattle food it consisted of maize and cattle cake for roughage;concentrated sugar beet for energy;consentrated Linseed Oil for protein.The cows also eat grass in the Summer and silage and hay in the Winter.A normal Fresian cow gives 25 to 30 litres of milk a day, but their prize cows give 52 litres a day. STOP PRESS_Since our visit we've heard that the cows won Five First Prizes; Several Second Prizes and the Supreme Championship Runner Up at the Royal Agricultural Show.
